Time Series

  1. UNHCR
  2. Time Series
=> Data source: The information about UNHCR's populations of concern for a given year and country of residence and/or origin.
Time Series by population type

We can clearly see that the numbers of asylum seekers and returned refugees are insignificant comparing to the number of refugees.
Time Series map by population type

This figure shows the evolution of the number of people depending on the population type. The most hosting countries are situated in Europe and Asia near the hot zones like the Middle East.

Looking at 2018:

Immigration types in the most recent given year.

Refugees around the world:

Bar Chart of the top 10 refugees hosting territories in 2018

In this analysis, we can clearly see that turkey has the highest number of refugees in 2018 with over 3.5M refugees on its soil. And this is due to the hige number of people coming from Syria.
HeatMap of the top 10 refugees hosting territories in 2018

This HeatMap represent the bar chart in a density form, the more the population is high the greener the color.

Asylum seekers around the world:

Bar Chart of the top 10 desirable territories in 2018

A lot of these countries are high on the list because they are near a troubled territory in the region. But there are countries like the USA which is desirable by a big number of asylum seekers even though it didn't make the top 10 of hosting countries.
HeatMap of the top 10 desirable territories in 2018

This HeatMap represent the bar chart in a density form, the more the population is high the greener the color.
Looking at the asylum seekers graphs and comparing them to the refugee graphs. An asylum seeker is someone whose claim has not yet been finally decided on by the country in which he or she has submitted it. Not every asylum seeker will ultimately be recognised as a refugee, but every refugee is initially an asylum seeker. Which is seen here. for example syrian refugees aspire to get to europe to seek asylum and perhaps attain the refugee status, but a heavy number of them get sent back to turkey.

In the next analysis,we are going to look at those asylum seekers in different countries.
